Description: Lip and wall sherd of East Greek (North Ionian) Late Wild Goat (black-figured) pottery plate; cream slip; exterior: on wall, banded decoration; on lower body, rays; frieze of dots on outer face of lip; on top stopt meander; on floor two animal friezes bordered by bands with added red bands lined in white; outer frieze has grazing wild goats to right, inner one perhaps birds; filling ornaments: rosettes and half-rosettes; red patches on neck, lower belly and on haunch of wild goats; incision used for part of the outline and for details of wild goats and of possible bird.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ1 ('bothros' / 'trench with bowls')
Curator's comments: Compare Boston 88.943, probably from the same plate. Context AΠ1 written in pencil
Bibliographic references: Price 1924 / Pottery of Naukratis (p. 197, fig. 26; pl. VII, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.752)
Walter-Karydi 1973 / Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts vor Christi: Landschaftsstile ostgriechischer Gefässe (no. 978, pl.112)
